description: This topics course explores a Spanish peninsular cultural, literary, and/or linguistic theme from a base in Spain through analysis and discussion of texts, guest lectures, excursions to appropriate cultural sites, field research, and related experiential activities. Sample topics include: Christians, Jews, and Muslims in Spain; Food, Migration, and Identity; and Spain's Multilingual and Multicultural Landscape. Taught in Spanish. Offered alternate years during January Term. Apply through Smith Center for Global Engagement. Also counts toward the Latin American studies major. Prerequisite: SPAN 250 or SPAN 251.
name: Spain's Cultural/Linguistic Legacy
title: Spain's Cultural and Linguistic Legacy
